techmeme.title: The White House announces an AI Education Pledge with commitments from 60+ companies to provide AI education materials to K-12 students over the next four years (Ashley Gold/Axios)
Kuo: Apple plans a cheaper MacBook powered by iPhone 16 Pro's A18 Pro chip and with a ~13" display, expected to enter mass production in late 2025 or early 2026 (Benjamin Mayo/9to5Mac)
Jim Chanos, who famously shorted Enron, calls Michael Saylor's bitcoin strategy "financial gibberish", as Saylor inspires several copycats like Trump Media (Peter Whoriskey/Washington Post)
How India is carving out space for high-end manufacturing, including a $2.5B Foxconn iPhone factory in Devanahalli, near Bengaluru, aiming to create 40K jobs (New York Times)
Sensor Tower: Temu's US MAU fell 51% to 40.2M from March to June, while Shein's dropped 12% to 41.4M, amid the US' China tariffs and "de minimis" closure (Financial Times)
